thesis.bot

Class PotentialCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • thesis.bot.PotentialCalculator

  • public class PotentialCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates the potential field that guides the movement of the bot. The default potential field is designed to keep the units at maximum shooting distance from a single enemy unit. The potential field can also be provided by an external component.
    Author:
    Oskari Leppäaho

      • getPotential

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getPotential

        private double getPotential(double x,
                  double y)
        Get the potential for coordinates. The potential is calculated by adding -(0.05 * enemyDistance - 5)^2 for each enemy unit. This potential tries to keep a single unit at it's maximum attacking range from a single enemy. Uses the potentialProvider if it was set. Otherwise uses the potential function defined here (changes frequently during development).
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        Total potential for the location.

      • getPotentialsAround

        double[] getPotentialsAround(bwapi.Unit u)
        Gets the potentials around an unit in 8 directions and the unit's current position. The potentials are measured in 1 pixel's distance from the unit's current position (diagonals included).
        Parameters:
        u - The unit around which to measure the potentials.
        Returns:
        An array with the potentials around the unit. The order is from top left to bottom right, row by row.

      • getMoveDirection

        bwapi.Position getMoveDirection(double[] potentials)
        Gets the move direction based on an array of potentials. The move direction will be the direction with the highest potential. Default value is (0,0: no movement).
        Parameters:
        potentials - An array of potentials around an unit. The order is from top left to bottom right, row by row.
        Returns:
        The direction corresponding to the highest potential.

      • getHighestPotentialPosition

        bwapi.Position getHighestPotentialPosition(bwapi.Position from,
                                         bwapi.Position dir,
                                         int distance)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks for the highest potential in each pixel coordinate from a position in a direction for a distance. If the potential is the same in all distances (or highest potentials are at the from position and some direction) returns the from position.
        Parameters:
        from - The position from which to start checking.
        dir - The direction in which to check. Should be a position with coordinates between -1 and 1.
        distance - Distance for which to check.
        Returns:
        The position with the highest potential. Default is the current position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
